task.title: Drag and Drop from Data Source Explorer View

context.p: Drag and drop operations from the Data Source Explorer view to the SQL Editor allows you to create SQL statements quickly by inserting the names of tables and columns in the SQL statements.

step.cmd: Configure a database connection (see the specific procedure for your database server in the Database Connection Support section).
Browse to the table you will use in your statement.
Drag the table or a column of the table into the editor where a SQL file is open.

stepresult.p: Drag and drop actions are available both on the table and on its fields. A pop-up menu is displayed in the SQL editor.

fig.title: SQL Statement Editing with Drag and Drop
SQL Statement Editing with Drag and Drop

step.cmd: Select the type of statement from the pop-up menu.

stepresult.p: Depending on your choice, dragging a table results in one of the following statements being inserted into the document:

ul.li: INSERT INTO`catalog`. `table` ( `field1`,`field2`, ....) VALUES (, , ) (for example: INSERT INTO `camera`.`cameraDesc` (`DEPT`,`DEPTNAME`,`LOCATION`) VALUES (, , ))

stepresult.p: Depending on your choice, dragging a column results in one of the following statements being inserted into the document:

ul.li: INSERT INTO`catalog`. `table` ( `field1) VALUES () (for example: INSERT INTO `camera`.`cameraDesc` (`DEPT`) VALUES ())
DELETE FROM `catalog`. `table` (for example: DELETE FROM `camera`.`cameraDesc` WHERE `DEPT`=)
